channel.title: Whonix forums not crawlable by archive.org
channel.description:
I've tried saving the thread with Goldstein's comments on Ethereum twice but at the end of the process a forum error page appears saying: oops private page or doesn't exist.
Does anyone know if there is a robots.txt problem or something to do with discourse?

item.title: Whonix forums not crawlable by archive.org

item.title: Whonix forums not crawlable by archive.org
item.dc:creator: mig5
item.description:
Discourse Meta ‚Äì 13 Mar 18

Make Discourse play nice with the Wayback Machine

Any news from the IA people? it would be great to see this issue fixed‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve tried to archive this historic post from the Let‚Äôs Encrypt people and archive.org made a page that says ‚ÄúOops! That page doesn‚Äôt exist or is private‚Äù, so clearly there‚Äôs...

Reading time: 8 mins üïë Likes: 100 ‚ù§

Issue seems to be that the WayBack machine forges the User-Agent to be that of the user that sent the request to save the page in the WayBack machine. Then it therefore gets a page designed to be evaluated by javascript (like our browsers) but can‚Äôt do so.

Probably can‚Äôt be fixed by us.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix forums not crawlable by archive.org

item.title: Whonix forums not crawlable by archive.org
item.dc:creator: mig5
item.description:
Hopefully was just bad timing indeed while I was restarting a service for other reasons? Seemed to save OK just now

EDIT: ahh I see what you mean, it saves but the site throws a Discourse error.

I suspect this is something to do with archive.org‚Äôs ability to evaluate javascript. Likely a Discourse thing in general. Will investigate

https://web.archive.org/web/20180901221603/http://forums.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/t/is-mysterium-blockchain-based-vpn-as-good-as-its-claimed-to-be/4029

Read full topic
